prefix.comment: use this prefix at the beginning of the name elements of yac resources, deaults to MAC for My Atlassian Cloud

delimitter.comment: use this delimitter between the name elements of yac resources

camelcase.comment: camelcase name elements when naming yac resources

cw_log_group_prefix.comment: prefix for cloud watch logs group that yac app logs will be aggregated under

s3_bucket.comment: s3 bucket that my apps will use for config files, backups, etc.

iam-role-default.comment: yac defaults to one role for all yac apps (this can be overriden in app-specific CF templates)

ssh-key-default.comment: yac defaults to one key pair for ssh access to all EC2 instances (this can be overriden in app-specific CF templates)

ssl-cert-default.comment: yac defaults to wildcard cert for all yac apps

corporate-cidr.comment: the CIDR defining addresses in your corporate domain (used for security group ingress/egress rules)

dns-cidr.comment: the CIDR defining addresses dns lookup services

outbound-proxy.comment: Outbound proxy in my vpc. If you VPC uses a NAS for accessing the public internet, leave blank breath easy.
outbound-proxy.comment-noproxy: Name regexes that should NOT be routed though outbound proxy. If you VPC uses a NAS for accessing the public internet, leave blank breath easy.

name_tag.comment: the name of the CF tag used to establish 'friendly name' of vpcs and subnets

availability_zones.comment: the availability zones to build into

subnets.comment1: The name of the subnets where yac resources should be placed.
subnets.comment2: If you have only two subnets, map dmz->private

db_subnet_group.comment: The name of the db subnet group where yac rds should be placed.

ntp_servers.comment: The ntp servers that can be polled to sync time. Use semicolon for delimitter

vpcs.comment: the default vpc for each environment (can typically be overriden via cli)

cname-suffix.comment: these suffixes will be assumed for app cnames. e.g. per these configs jira dev cname is assumed 'jiradev'

domain.comment: containers will redirect from http to https (including http://non-fqdn to https://fqdn), but need domain info to pull this off
